name: Stella Di Mare Beach Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week -The attention to detail was excellent. The grounds are beautiful, the sunbeds are cleaned at the end if each day, each area has it's own towels when you move- you have to have new towels!! We had a deluxe room with a sea view, we were on floor one- with a garden terrace. Lots of people on trip advisor rate the rooms on the higher floors but I liked the easy access to the pool for early swims and, as it was quite windy while we were there, it was sheltered.
reviews.title: Attention to detail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast offers a huge choice and you can sit outside which is very much the chilled out way to do it. At busy times tables outside are difficult to come by, I would like to know how much the german guy tipped to get his table every morning- hey ho- we just sat in the sun and waited!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel – OK service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: We went B&B and frequently got the free bus into Naama bay- out at 7 back at 10!! Time to hit the happy hour in the Camel bar and some cheap and delicious food in one of the top restaurants recommended by trip advisor.
reviews.title: I didn't think I'd enjoy ai - how wrong I was.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did eat in the hotel- the oriental food was lovely, great nibbles at lunchtime and a seafood evening, beach bar was exactly what it said on the label. Drinks are expensive but that is the choice you make when you don't select All inclusive.
reviews.title: Half term break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The snorkelling off the beach is fantastic.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Great Feedback and Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: - located close to Naama Bay; free shuttle bus from/to Naama ensured by the hotel;
reviews.title: Amazing Family Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - 2 large heated pools each with excellent positions facing the sea (pool bar at the 3rd level pool);
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Amazing Location and Great Staff....
Excellent Family Holiday
reviews.text: - kids corner and kids pool sides practically and good positioned;

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - 1 small heated pool dedicated to the spa centre which include 2 aquatic bikes inside;
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Myself and two friends booked four nights at the Stella di Mare as girls' trip away in the sun. We booked a triple room on an all inclusive basis. This was my first ever experience of all inclusive and I was a bit nervous of endless nasty buffets, but it turned out to be a good decision and good value.
reviews.title: Great for a Relaxing Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our visit didn't get off to the best start as we were kept waiting a very long time in the lounge while they checked us in, even though we were were the only ones that got dropped off at the hotel by the shuttle. The welcome drink was refreshing but a faster check in would have been appreciated, especially as it was 7pm and we were hungry! When we got to our room instead of being a triple we had a double and a single bed. The single bed was an auxiliary bed, which was fine, but it was dusty and broken. When we asked to move rooms we were told 'we will move you in the morning.' It was only after we were very insistent that we didn't want to unpack and re-pack in the morning that they found us an alternate room that met our needs. We ended up in a much nicer room with great sea and pool views, which was appreciated. The room was comfortable and clean with a great bathroom and the housekeeping staff did a good job throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Great winter getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was decent and we tried all the restaurants as we preferred a la carte. We also visited the local town at Naama Bay. Having travelled all over Egypt it was definitely a 'tourist town' but the touts are not as aggressive as I've experienced elsewhere and the shopping and restaurants met our needs as people who were away for a break in the sun. The alcohol included in our package at the hotel was good enough quality, although it would have been nice if they had sparkling wine. As someone who likes nothing more than cocktail hour and wine with my dinner then going all inclusive made it good value!
reviews.title: Our Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, I had a relaxing break, which was what I was after. I would book again at the Stella di Mare.
reviews.title: Amazing, amazing, amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: February 2012.
reviews.title: Great Days, not so good Evenings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb Hotel. Must be 5 Star plus. The best service I have ever experienced in a hotel. We were treated like personal friends of the owner, even though we have no connection. Everyone was truly wonderful. You would be mad to stay anywhere else in Sharm El Sheikh!
reviews.title: Exceeded All Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great hotel with a great beach. Their Spa is also very clean and relaxing. There was, however; a misunderstanding as they had checked us into a room that had not been previously cleaned and was apparently housing a couple of barn animals before us! Never have I witnessed such a messed up hotel room in my life! After a couple of ours we were redirected to a different room.
reviews.title: Will be going back
Lovely and friendly!
reviews.text: We came here for a weeks holiday and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The staff an the management were friendly and listen to what you have to say and put your suggestions to use. The food is amazing and the hotel room was lovely! I'm only sad that I did not get to see one of those amazing towel sculptures that everyone seemed to have on their beds each day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that it was a really lovely holiday!
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Been to Egypt eleven times and we think we have found the perfect hotel. The facilities were fantastic, 5* and we're complemented by 6* staff. Yossef Yezk is the best barman we have ever had and is a credit to the hotel. We will be returning next year without doubt!!! Mike and Diane- Durham.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Me, my husband and 2 children, stayed at this hotel for the 3rd time from 26/10/13 - 02/11/13, and again the hotel was excellent.
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff really make your holiday special, around the pool, Bob and Ashraf Ezzat always made sure towels where ready on sunbeds, and brought along glasses of water and melon, cleaned our sunglasses and where always very friendly. The pool bar staff are also always very helpful, especially Mohammed a Aal and Mohamed Gamel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed all inclusive and ate at all of the restaurants, which where all excellent, Sherif in the main restaurant is always very accommodating and friendly. We preffered to eat at the Asian restaurant at lunch overlooking the sea. The Asian restaurant Manager, Shenouda, is very friendly and has an excellent team, as all of the staff are exceptional, Radwan, Mohammed and not forgetting Habib, who is the nicest friendliest guy you could meet, nothing is too much effort, for all of the staff, during our holiday it was my daughters 13 Birthday, they organised a cake and sang Happy Birthday during the Asian restaurants entertainment evening, must not forget, the food here is also fantastic. We had interconnecting rooms on the 8th floor which provided excellent views. The rooms where always cleaned to a high standard and the towel art that our cleaner Hishram created was brilliant, especially the towel cake, he took the time to create for my daughters Birthday.
reviews.title: WOW, WOW, WOW!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all an excellent holiday and yet again this hotel surpasses itself, and we look forward to another week in February.
reviews.title: The best hotel in sharm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been fortunate enough to have travelled quite a bit and have had the privilege of staying in some great hotels in different continents of the world.
reviews.title: The Stella 'customer service' is INCREDIBLE - stay there and experience it yourselves

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had enquired from other tripadvisors before we went to Stella Di Mare so we were expecting a lovely holiday and it was everything we had hoped for. We had ten days from 20th Feb.
reviews.title: Worth every penny !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other reviewers have covered most areas so I hope mine are not too repetitive.
reviews.title: A quick week in the sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: 1. All Inclusive worked for us as we did not want to explore outside the hotel. We just wanted to relax after a very stressful few years. So we ate, slept, ate and slept. Did us the power of good! We kept to the local beer and spirits and they were perfect. All Inclusive was worth every penny and as everyone knows, we get what we pay for! And we certainly saved some money.
reviews.title: from snow to sand : we will go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2.We never felt the food was boring. A huge selection, We also had the All Inclusive menu at the Corallo Rosso and La Scogliera. The chefs in both restaurants presented superb food and although the choice was very limited we did not feel it was any less special than the "A La Carte" menus. We decided that the Corallo Rosso was our favourite for the quality and quantity of food but only just. They were both really very good.
reviews.title: Best All Inclusive Hotel I've stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. The weather was very warm until 3 p.m. when the temperature would drop and the wind got stronger. So it was siesta time then! Perfect for us. Some days it would get quite chilly in the afternoon and everyone would disappear from the pool and beach, probably to siesta too! Then a shower or long soak prior to pre-dinner cocktails at the bar. (Oh, wish we were still there).
reviews.title: Brilliant Holiday!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Although we had asked when booking for our two rooms to be close together, it took some time at checkin to organise this. Maybe because I had got a cheap internet deal. The rooms themselves were very nice and the beds good.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel with nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the other posters that all the staff were very nice indeed and gave no impression of expecting tips as we went along. I did tip well at the end and they all seemed very pleased.
reviews.title: Cant fault this place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food was good and breakfast particularly was more efficient and better than many other hotels in Egypt. Service everywhere was very prompt. I had booked B and b and was offered half board for USD 28, I think, and AI for USD 75 a day each. We eventually spent much less than USD75 just signing for things and paying at the end, but if you want lots of cocktails the bill will mount up.
reviews.title: Better and better....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was plenty of room round the pools etc and they were all warm enough and large enough to swim. The snorkelling off the hotel jetty was nice.
reviews.title: If you want good toast avoid this hotel ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is a decent tennis court without lights and they will lend you raquets and balls. There is a pool table which is sadly popular, and pingpong. The staff try hard and put on karaoke, belly dancing and similar events in the evening, as well as some activities during the day.
reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING, FAR BETTER OPTIONS AVAILABLE IN SHARM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted somewhere special in the sun to celebrate our Golden Wedding anniversary. Having read Trip Advisor reviews carefully we chose the Stella Di Mare and selected a superior de Luxe room and what a brilliant choice it turned out to be. during 50 years of marriage we have stayed at countless hotels in many countries and we rate this hotel the best ever! From the moment we arrived with the complimentary transfer, to the fastest check in ever where we were presented with refreshing drinks and towels,until the moment we departed, we were thoroughly pampered. This hotel is beautifully situated on the beach with fabulous views across the bay. It has an extensive beach area,wonderful pools and restaurants and immaculate lawns and gardens. In fact the whole hotel is immaculate. Our Egyptian themed room had every creature comfort and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel. Best of all though is the friendliness and care of the staff. The Egyptian people are naturally hospitable and welcoming but they all go that extra mile at this hotel. We enjoyed a wonderful beachside 'romantic dinner' with soft music.flowers and all the trimmings on our anniversary and a complimentary chocolate cake on my birthday and anniversary' The experience on the beach is wonderful, plenty of sunbeds and fresh towels every day, regular cool water and fruit and even your sunglasses cleaned every day. Little things but certainly with our beach attendant Ehab done with a smile and a chat for everyone.and it makes everyone feel like a special guest. We stayed on a B & B basis and only had meals other than breakfast twice in the evening and lunch at the beach bar these were good. We have had a better choice of breakfasts in other hotels but they are adequate. There is a quiet piano bar and a good disco and of course lots of entertainment in Sharm itself. The hotel is a little way out of Sharm el Sheikh centre, but the complimentary shuttle bus is easy and efficient and taxis are cheap. As you can gather we loved this hotel and can't wait to return. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making this a holiday that will live in our memory for all the right reasons!
reviews.title: Our wonderful Golden Wedding! Mike & Kath from Derbyshire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful holiday at the Stella di Mare- great service- friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms- will definatly be back!!
reviews.title: Absolutly perfect!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from one week at this great hotel. After our first Egyptian holiday to Luxor in 2010 which was awful (mainly due to sickness) this hotel restored our confidence with Egypt. As we arrived the friendly staff greeted us with a refreshing towel. We were then escorted to our fabulous room. Things just continued to impress us.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: We stayed B&B simply due to our past experience in Luxor but found the hotel food to be excellent. There was plenty of variety and service by the staff was good. For our last meal of the holiday we ate at the hotel's Asian 'La Scogliera' restaurant and it was amazing.
reviews.title: Perfect place to unwind and relax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: The hotel facilities were very good and catered for all our needs. There was plenty of variety in locations for sunbathing, all giving easy access to the sea for some good snorkelling. You were not hassled whilst sunbathing but staff were always about to provide drinks immediately. You even get your sunglasses cleaned.
reviews.title: Amazing resort with excellent facilities and service

aka: Stella Di Mare Beach Hotel And Spa
description: This luxurious 5-star full resort is located on the entrance of the famous Naama Bay. Gourmet dining, expert diving lessons, and evening entertainment, all with stunning views of the Red Sea. The rooms at Stella di Mare Beach Hotel and Spa feature a contemporary design, and are fully modern with flat screen TVs and free Wi-Fi. Each room includes a private balcony or terrace. Guests can enjoy the Naama Bay’s famous diving and snorkeling waters. Stella di Mare has a state-of-the-art PADI diving center and training facilities on-site. A lavish 600 square metre spa and Wellness Centre offers guests full relaxation. Saunas, steam Turkish baths, indoor and outdoor Jacuzzis are available. Guests can swim in the Stella di Mare’s grand outdoor pool, with panoramic views of the surrounding area. The Stella's acclaimed á la carte restaurants offer a variety of dishes from Mediterranean cuisine to Sushi, all prepared by a team of highly-trained international chefs. We also offer guests the chance to play golf on our fantastic short course. Guest's can play whilst enjoying spectacular views of the clear blue sea and can also benefit from our professional golf instructor. Guests can enjoy cocktails and evening dancing at the Bubbles Disco. The Stella di Mare Beach Hotel and Spa also provides its own evening entertainment program, featuring local Egyptian belly-dancers and international singers nightly. The Resort is located just 10 km from Sharm el-Sheikh International Airport. Free parking is available on-site. Hotel Rooms: 298.
